definition: angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: During the day at night world, is a solo.
sentences.chinese: 白天裏上演着花花世界，夜晚卻是一個人的獨角戲。

sentences.english: Love there are no monologue, only the heart and heart operation.
sentences.chinese: 愛情裏沒有獨角戲，只有心與心的經營。

sentences.english: Clarion is blowing, it's time for your monodrama.
Likewise, open-course teachers need to stop playing "solo".
sentences.chinese: 開放教師也要改變自己唱“獨角戲”的局面。

sentences.english: So I spin in the dance of your absence and put on a show.
sentences.chinese: 你不在了，我自己旋轉着跳舞，上演一場獨角戲。

sentences.english: Moondog did monologues, played bamboo pipes and whistles.
sentences.chinese: “月亮狗”會演獨角戲，還會吹竹笛，吹口哨。

sentences.english: He'll soon realize that it's better to play a part in a big show than try to run a one-man show.
sentences.chinese: 他馬上就會看到演獨角戲不如搭班子好。

sentences.english: He decided to give a one-man show.
Let hime solo, and you go along.
sentences.chinese: 讓他一個人演獨角戲吧，你就陪襯一下。

sentences.english: Viewpoint 3, it is good that Chongqing has foundation and actual strength to act " monodrama " .
sentences.chinese: 觀點三，重慶有基礎和實力演好“獨角戲”。

sentences.english: Jim's was a one-man show and he ran it brilliantly.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆演的是獨角戲，並且演得很出色。

definition: lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
